formats.name: micro_twist
formats.instruction: Compose a single-sentence insight that flips a common assumption upside down. No more than 30 words. Avoid explanations.

formats.name: confession
formats.instruction: Share a brief, surprising confession related to the topic. Open with 'I admit...' and describe how you discovered the truth. Keep it personal and punchy, 50-80 words.

formats.name: secret_manual
formats.instruction: Draft a hypothetical 'secret manual' for surviving or thriving with a specific thing. Include quirky tips, warnings, and hidden tricks in 120-180 words.

formats.name: echo_chamber_escape
formats.instruction: Describe the process of breaking out of an echo chamber, including the moment you noticed and what changed afterwards. Should have a turning point. 200-300 words.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Give advice that sounds wrong at first but turns out genuinely helpful. Start with 'Everyone says X, but instead try Y.' Explain why in under 120 words.

formats.name: imagined_future
formats.instruction: Forecast a day in the life in a radically different future. Paint the details, interactions, and small joys/struggles. 300-400 words.

formats.name: snapshot_memory
formats.instruction: Capture a visceral moment or scene from your life in vivid detail—set the mood, sounds, and feelings. 80-150 words.

formats.name: bad_idea_brief
formats.instruction: Propose an intentionally impractical solution to a real problem, then explain the kernel of wisdom hidden inside the absurdity. 70-120 words.

formats.name: parallel_universe
formats.instruction: Introduce an alternate reality where one variable is different. Show the ripple effects in three distinct ways, 180-250 words.

title_styles: Write a playful, pun-laden title that teases your post without giving everything away.
Write a title that makes readers imagine themselves in an unusual scenario. Example: 'Imagine waking up to find X...'
Craft a title that challenges the reader directly, e.g. 'Dare to rethink your beliefs about X'
Use an eccentric, metaphor-driven title. Example: 'Coffee shops are the campfires of modern life'
Make your title a question that sounds almost like a riddle: 'What would happen if X never existed?'
structure_variants: Begin with a vivid sensory description, then transition to your main argument.
Break your post into 'myth', 'reality', and 'what now?' sections.
Include a brief fictional interlude (a mini-scene or conversation) amid your factual writing.
Frame your post like a set of diary entries from different days.
Conclude with a wild speculation—go beyond what seems reasonable.
topic_angles: The hidden rituals and routines people use to feel safe

Analyzing the strange economics of niche hobbies
The psychology of making peace with uncertainty
Surreal encounters and what they triggered in behavior
